title: Update App from Previous Version *[requires ticket]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user installed a previous version of the Ballpark app 
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has selected a favorite team
AND user has at least one ticketed event on their account
AND user has navigated to team tab
custom_steps:
WHEN Ballpark app is left in background
AND Ballpark app version is upgraded by installing a new version
custom_expected: THEN User should be on latest version, should be logged in and all data retained.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Loading previous production version from AppStore
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Previous version installs properly.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Log in with a user, preferably one with various tickets.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Login successful.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Profile > About Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN previous app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User navigates to Profile -> Favorite Teams AND has a favorite team

WHEN User navigates to Tickets > Wallet AND views tickets, including barcodes within Scan view

WHEN User navigates to Team Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Everything should load with correct data.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user background the Ballpark app

WHEN Download the production version from Firebase App distro or TestFlight if the production version has been pushed to TestFlight. 
AND User opens the new version of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN App should replace and load properly form the previous build

AND User remains logged in. 

NOTE - This is the most important thing to verify - the DB/user's login data is preserved and then user doesn't have to login again.

custom_steps_separated.content: HEN User goes to Profile > About Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Upgraded app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Profile -> Favorite Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User's prior favorite team is preserved

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Tickets > Wallet
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Users ticket is shown with correct data

title: Onboarding New Signup
custom_preconds: GIVEN User has installed the app, starts app for first time and is presented with Splash Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps option to get started 

(if prev logged into the device on prev BP versions, then 'Continue with MLB' button will be shown. If this is the case, tap 'Don't have an account? Sign up' link)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is presented with Sign Up screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid first and last name, email address, password, and Date of Birth
AND user taps 'Continue'


NOTE: First and Last name can be any character including space and special characters
NOTE: DOB does not have a lower boundary restriction for Year - ex: 01/01/0001 is considered valid
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful
AND Home Tab is presented

title: Onboarding User - Installing BP app via Branch Deeplink *[requires app store]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user does not have BP app installed previously (delete any/all instances from device)
AND user has been given a branch deeplink to access the app
AND user does not have an existing MLB account
custom_steps:
WHEN user accesses the deeplink 
AND user in directed to App store (Android/iOS)
AND user installed the app
AND user creates a new account and completes onboarding
custom_expected:
THEN the deferred deep link resolves and user navigates to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link

** Examples: deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/cubs directs user to Cubs team page, while deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet directs user to Wallet page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses the deeplink - https://bp.mlb.com/cubs
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed to App store prompting install of Ballpark App

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user installs BP* 

IOS NOTE: Testflight can be substituted, if desired version has not been released
Android NOTE: *requires for user to be part of internal testers to allow for install of Release Candidate from Playstore prior to launch. AppTester build can be substituted, if not part of internal tester group OR if desired version has not been released
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN installation of BP app completes successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented with Splash Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps option to get started

(iOS may show 'Continue with MLB' button if prev logged into the device on prev versions. If this is the case, tap 'Don't have an account? Sign up' link)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Onboarding process begins by presenting user the Sign Up Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid data for all the fields
AND user submits continue
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/cubs was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Cubs team page)

title: Reset Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app
AND user is NOT logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has navigated to Log In page
AND user has tapped "Forgot Password?" to show the Reset Password view
custom_steps: [THIS CASE REQUIRES A PASSWORD CHANGE TO OCCUR - IT IS BEST TO ONBOARD A NEW ACCT WITH A VALID EMAIL ADDRESS, TO PREVENT CHANGING PW ON SHARED TEST ACCOUNTS]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps into 'Email' 
AND user enters a valid email
AND user taps "Submit"

[NOTE: Rule exists 'Your password cannot be any of your last 2 passwords' - so have caution on acct used, if acct is shared]
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the text "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."
AND an email is sent to the email entered

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates from Reset Password view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Log In page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user successfully updates the password (via email)
AND logs in with the new credentials
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is successfully logged into Ballpark App

title: Upcoming Games - MatchupGame (requires location enabled, statsAPI data)
custom_preconds:

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*

AND user satisfies criteria to show upcoming sections [see case](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/34569713 )

* Event description string, if available

**
Note: certain locations will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each

**
Note: certain locations will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each

title: Next Ticketed Event - EventHub (GameEvents)

AND user is shown an envelope icon at the top left, representing inbox

AND user is shown an image in the background (top) - green field w/ pitching mound

Ticket Information - Each ticket clearly shows the following information:
* Matchup: Teams playing (e.g., "Nationals at Royals")
** Start Time: Date and time of the event (e.g., "Sun, May 28 • 1:35 PM CT")
** Venue: Name of the stadium (e.g., "Kauffman Stadium")

AND user taps 'Access Tickets'

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has forwarded all tickets in the next upcoming game

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown the event metadata - Team Names, Date, Start Time, Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user views the Next Ticketed Event w/ ALL tickets forwarded
AND user taps 'Access Tickets'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to Scanview
AND the ticket(s) are shown as forwarded, with a Recall cta shown

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user views the Next Ticketed Event
AND user taps card (above 'Access Tickets')

title: Maps Basic Functionality
custom_preconds: User has navigated to Team Tab and selected a team page which has a map available

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User clicks on map item on Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Map screen is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Map Screen is presented
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Top Toolbar displays Venue Name
AND there is a dropdown to select various levels
AND there are filter buttons at the bottom
AND there is a map displayed
AND display of the map can be maximized by swiping down
AND there is a search icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User selects level from dropdown
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Map display is updated to display selected level 
AND list of amenities is updated based on selected level

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on item in amenities list
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN details about the selected amenity is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User swipes left and right on filter buttons
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user can view all possible filter buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on a filter button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Map is displayed with POIs which meet the filter criteria

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on search icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is presented a text field with magnify glass to the left, 'Search for Amenities' within the text field, and 'Cancel' to the right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps in 'Search for Amenities' on text field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented with device keyboard and can enter search criteria(i.e 'beer') and get results

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on one of the presented results fitting the entered criteria
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the specific POI (point of interest) will be shown from the bottom sheet 

(a 'menu' button may or may not be shown - examples:'bathroom' would not show a menu NOR would an entry not configured to show, such as like 'Dippin Dots')

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps on search icon
AND user taps 'Cancel'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the page displaying a text field 'Search for Amenities' is closed
AND the map page is shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on POI (point of interest)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN details about the POI of interest is displayed in dialog which slides up from bottom

title: Profile Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)
custom_steps: WHEN Accessing Profile page via Profile tab
custom_expected: THEN Profile page display

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the Profile icon from Navbar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a generic profile avatar 
AND user is shown their full name displayed 
AND user is shown their favorite team logo (if acct has a fave team prev saved)
AND user is shown their email address 
AND an "Edit" option is displayed in the top right corner
AND "My History" section with relevant data and an actionable icon is shown

THEN the user is shown 'My History' card layered atop the profile card with the User's (check ins) from their My History data:
* Total Check-Ins - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist
* Total Teams Seen - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist 
* Total Ballparks Visited - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist 
* 'View Details' blue text link navigating user to My History 

NOTE: If history data is unavailable display dashes for history counts. User is still able to navigate to My History

THEN the user is shown links to settings items with icons displayed next to each row
* Favorite Teams
* App Notifications
* MLB Account Emails
* Ticket Accounts
* About Ballpark
* Close MLB Account
* Customer Support
* Do Not Share or Sell My Data (Does not override Apple's Do Not Track Settings)


IF User enrolled to GAE then MLB Go-Ahead ID also display
THEN the user is shown 'Log Out' button below list items

title: Profile - Edit Mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user in on Profile page

Relevant links:
*Mocks:[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=1284%3A14013)
EDIT MODE:
*iOS:[BP-9188](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9188)
custom_steps:
WHEN user is on Profile view 
AND User tap on Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN user will be taken to the First/ Last name edit form 

Design: 
Title: Edit Profile 
First Name field 
Last Name field 
Save Changes CTA (filled with black color and White text color)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user removes all the characters the First name field
AND user navigates to the Last name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "First Name is required"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user removes all the characters the Last name field
AND user navigates to the First name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Last Name is required"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user types more than 40 characters in the First name field
AND user navigates to the Last name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Invalid First Name entered"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form 
AND user types more than 40 characters in the Last name field
AND user navigates to the First name field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Invalid Last Name entered"

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid First name and Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will see the saving animation
AND user will be taken back to Profile view
AND user will be able to see my recently modified name updated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid First name and Last name with multiple names (i.e Vlad Guerrero Jr., Michael Harris II, Isiah Kiner-Falefa)
AND user taps on Save Changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will see the saving animation
AND user will be taken back to Profile view
AND user will be able to see my recently modified name updated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on edit form AND makes changes to the name fields 
BUT user taps on '<' without saving changes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be taken back to Profile view
AND User will be able to see the names NOT updated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid and different First name and/or Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes
AND user quit the app, and restarts the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user updated data for profile name should be maintained

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid and different First name and/or Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes
AND user log out of the app and log back in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user updated data for profile name should be maintained

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user have no network connection*
AND user enters valid and different First name and/or Last name 
AND user taps on Save Changes


*device set to airplane mode can be done to simulate
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the error text "Profile update failed. Try again later."

title: Auto Check-In: At the ballpark during the game *[requires mock loc app/service & schedule]
custom_preconds:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/CLUBTOOLS-1486

As a fan attending an event who loves My History & free stuff from offers, I want the current game added to my history and all the offers unlocked when I’m in the ballpark

GIVEN The user is logged in and satisfies all conditions needed to allow a Check-in to occur

Note to complete a check-in User must:
* have location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device
* have device located at the venue (can be mocked)
* have a home game scheduled at the team venue within 3 hrs of device time AND also prior to after 6 hrs of game time (can be mocked)

NOTE: Auto Check-in feature is ticket agnostic, meaning that expected behavior should be verified both with AND without tickets

b) Connecting to a Proxy tool (i.e. CharlesProxy, Proxyman) and triggering the call from BP app
c) via DataDog logs for the users session/trace calls

title: Okta Access Expires Prior to Pull to Refresh
custom_preconds:
SETUP NOTES:
You will need to have tickets available to the account you will be using.
You will need to have an account that has an access token that expires in 5 minutes. There are two options to set up this scenario:
1) If you use Charles or Proxyman, you can set the timeout to ~360 seconds (6 minutes) by finding the call to qa-ids.mlb.com and overriding the response. If its earlier than 6mins, the refresh may happen automatically.
2) You can alternatively use an account that has a access token lifetime set to 5 minutes (in account policies) i.e. bparkdev+5mintoken@gmail.com.

GIVEN a user is logged in
AND User is on Tickets Tab
custom_steps:
WHEN Okta access token expires
AND user performs a pull to refresh (or button tap of 'Refresh')
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user logs in with their MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user is on the Tickets tab w/ tickets for a future event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND Ticket Tab page displays with Wallet Card

custom_steps_separated.content: [AWAIT EXPIRATION OF ACCESS TOKEN]

WHEN the user access token expires
AND the user navigates to Tickets Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be logged out
AND user is shown the Welcome Screen (Keychain stored)

[NOTE: If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user attempts to log in again (either via Continue, or enter acct creds flow)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is successfully logged in (with a refreshed access token)
AND the user is able to view the tickets on the account

[BP-10171](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10171 )


GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (BPapp: 12.2.0 or greater, iOS: 16.2 or greater)
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND the user has tickets already added to the BP account configured for Live Activities (TM and TDC events)
AND NTEv2 Home Card is configured (via Card Creator) for the specific venue of the NextTicketed Event (BPapp: 13.1.1 or greater)

**Spring Venues are NOT currently supported for Live Activities feature**
**NonGame Events (Concerts, Tours, Test Events, Etc) are NOT currently supported for Live Activities feature**
custom_expected: THEN section, row and seat is displayed in the pre-game state for both TDC & TM clubs in the Live Activity Lock Screen widget

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs into BP app with a TDC event as next upcoming event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Home page with a Next Ticketed Event card (for TDC club)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user closes BP app (cold start)
AND the user navigates to lock screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's lock screen displays a Live Activity for the event showing:
*Ballpark logo (top left w/in widget)
*Team matchup logos (top right w/in widget)
*Seat information - Sec/Row/Seat (bottom left w/in widget)
*Game start time (bottom right w/in widget)
**time shown in time zone of device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the lock screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the Scanview of the event listed in the Live Activity
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

title: Onboarding - Success
custom_preconds:
Android: [BPA-7052](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7052 ) / [BPA-7105](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7105)
iOS: [BP-10293](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10293 ) / [BP-10337](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10337)


GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed ANDROID 12.8.0 or later, iOS 12.3.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game to PHI (or has Phillies set as fave team)*


*PHI club is pilot club - however, onboarding a facial image is not currently tied to specific club/event
custom_steps: GIVEN User display with Context Card for GoAhead-Entry(FFI) Registration on Home Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User is on the Home Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I am displayed a Home GoAheadEntry context card (Register CTA)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on Home GoAheadEntry context card's Register CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Go Ahead Entry SDK should launch without any errors

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user lands on GO-AHEAD ENTRY flow using FFI SDK
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User display with Get Started screen with title of GO-AHEAD ENTRY

AND a middle section will be show that allows swiping to additional pages w/ further instructions

AND the initial page text shows: 
Title: Sign up for MLB's Go-Ahead Entry at Citizens Bank Park

Description: Register for MLB Go-Ahead Entry, the ultimate hands-free experience available for free to ticketed fans entering Citizens Bank Park.
AND a button shown w/ text 'Get Started' [button is disabled initially]

AND a checkbox is shown w/ text 'By tapping "Get Started" I agree to MLB's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy' [checkbox is unchecked initially]

*Terms of Use is a link directing user to external browser with Terms
*Privacy Policy is a link directing user to external browser with Policy

[iOS Terms and PP links are not underlined]
AND a checkbox is shown w/ text 'I attest that I am eighteen (18) years of age or older.' [checkbox is unchecked initially]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scroll left to right (2nd screen)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user display with an instruction for the complete the flow 

Title: 
First we'll capture an image of your face.

Description:
This image will be used by a service provider solely to create an alphanumeric MLB Go-Ahead ID for you and then immediately discarded. 

AND 'Learn more' CTA underlined 
AND Get Started button remains disabled
AND Terms and Services checkbox is displayed without check
AND Age confirmation checkbox is displayed without check


*Learn more is a link directing user to external browser with more info
AND user display with Cancel or X button on Top left to dismiss the GoAhead registration

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scroll left to right (3rd screen)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user continue with display an instruction for the complete flow 

Title: 
At the ballpark, head to a Go-Ahead Entry lane at the First Base Gate

Description:
Your tickets will already be tied to your Go-Ahead ID. All ticketed individuals in your group will be captured by the Go-Ahead cameras.


AND 'Learn more' CTA underlined 
AND Get Started button remains disabled
AND Terms and Services checkbox is displayed without check
AND Age confirmation checkbox is displayed without check


*Learn more is a link directing user to external browser with more info

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User acknowledges Terms and Privacy
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be able to checkmark MLB ID Terms of Use and Privacy Policy

(Checkbox filled up with black color)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User acknowledges Age
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND User should be able to checkmark the age stipulation 
I attest that I am eighteen (18) years of age or older.
THEN Get Started button should be enabled with black color in white text

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Get Started' within the Go-Ahead Entry page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[SKIP VALIDATION IF CAMERA ACCESS WAS PREV ALLOWED - PROCEED TO EXPECTATION STEP 17]

THEN user should display with Camera Prompt 

Android/iOS: 
Standard Existing Camera Promot modal OR 
"Ballpark" Would Like to Access the Camera 
Ballpark uses the camera to capture photos and videos. 

AND 'Don't Allow' and 'Okay' CTAs shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN prompt for Camera permission is denied
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user taken back to onboarding flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN prompt for Camera permission is allowed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be able to proceed with NEC for enrollment to Go Ahead Entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap Okay (Permission allowed)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user should be granted with an interface provides a clear indication of the action that requires approval to capture confirmation 


GO-AHEAD ENTRY shows in Home Plate with MLB logo

Description:
We’ll take a quick capture to generate your MLB Go-Ahead ID

AND 'Continue' CTA shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap on Continue
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be directed to capture their facial image 

Text display: 
Keep your face in the frame ....

[iOS verbiage may differ - i.e. No Faces were detected inside the frame.]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap on Cancel(iOS) or  X(android)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[Android] THEN user should directs to Home 
[iOS] THEN user should directs to previous page 

[The current behavior on iOS makes more sense for Apple’s navigation architecture]

AND user should display with Cancel button on top left (or Back arrow)
AND recording indicator (typically on top right)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user successfully captured their facial image for Go-Ahead ID 
AND NEC acceptance met
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND Home plate icon should show in green color with MLB standard logo in it (SKIP THIS FOR 12.8 ANDROID) 

AND user display with loading indicator displayed when image validation is in-progress 

AND lottie animation within home plate shows on screen while generating Go-Ahead ID 

Text display: 
Generating Go-Ahead ID...

THEN user should display with confirmation screen for successful enrollment in GoAhead

Green (dotted) check icon mark
Text: 
You're all set!
Thanks for registering! When you arrive at the ballpark enter at the First Base Gate in the designated Go-Ahead Entry lane

AND 'Learn more about GO-Ahead Entry' should display in green color with an underline shown

AND 'Done' CTA shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Learn more about GO-Ahead Entry'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed to an external webview* opened to the URL that is configured in Remote Config (go_ahead_learn_more_url)

*external webview in default browswer

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Done within Go-Ahead confirmation screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user taken to Home page of Ballpark App 
AND user display with context card that they have successfully enrolled to Go-Ahead Entry (Learn More CTA)

title: MLB Go-Ahead ID
custom_preconds:
iOS: [BP-10587](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10587)

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (14.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has already completed the successful enrollment in Go-Ahead Entry program (required for drawer option to be shown --  ballpark://go-ahead can be used to register to GAE)
AND user navigates to My Profile page (via Profile Navbar)
custom_steps: GIVEN User on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on Profile page
AND user has already completed the successful enrollment in Go-Ahead Entry program
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be display with drawer option "MLB Go-Ahead ID" on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User is on Profile page
AND user hasn't completed the successful enrollment in Go-Ahead Entry program
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should not display with drawer option "MLB Go-Ahead ID" on Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps on the "MLB Go-Ahead ID"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN selection of "MLB Go-Ahead ID" leads user to new view

AND New view should displays user enrollment status [Enrolled (in blue background w/ white text) 

MLB Go-Ahead ID - Header/Title

'<' on top left corner in same line as MLB Go-Ahead ID

Text Display: 
The Go-Ahead Entry experience allows you to enter the stadium hands-free and is available at select ballparks. 
Tap here for more information and a list of participating ballparks.


'Delete MLB Go-Ahead ID' display in white within black pills button

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to an external browser opened to an appropriate page* with more information on Go Ahead Entry

*the webpage is configured as 'go_ahead_mlb_ballparks_url' in remote config

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates back to BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MLB Go-Ahead ID page is shown

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps on the "MLB Go-Ahead ID"
AND user taps on "Delete MLB Go-Ahead ID"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display a Deletion prompt modal 

Body/Text: 

Delete MLB GO-Ahead ID 
Deleting your MLB Go-Ahead ID will remove your ID and require re-enrollment in the program. 

Delete Go-ahead ID - CTA
Cancel - CTA

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user select "Delete Go-Ahead ID" on the Deletion prompt modal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is removed from Go-Ahead entry program
AND the user is returned to Profile page 
AND the Profile page no longer shows MLB Go-Ahead ID entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user successfully Unenrolled from MLB Go-Ahead ID
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should not display with MLB Go-Ahead Entry/ID drawer option on Profile page

title: Ticket is actively listed on SeatGeek, ticket cannot be listed elsewhere or relisted on SeatGeek
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User on Ballpark app (Android 13.4 & iOS 13.2.1 above) 

Context: Box Office is updating the flag needed to determine eligibility for listing tickets on SeatGeek. This replaces the current flag of “resellable”. 



Flag resellableOnExclusiveMarketplace: 
**
Note**
Status of True = Ticket is eligible for listing 
Status of False = Ticket is not eligible for listing
custom_steps:
GIVEN the user  ticket is actively listed on SeatGeek, ticket cannot be listed elsewhere or relisted on SeatGeek
WHEN the user view listed ticket w/in Ballpark list view
custom_expected:
THEN Ballpark's Ticket ListView reflects the status of the ticket listed from w/in MPV
AND user display with `Go to Secondary Market to manage selling this ticket` display for ticket listed by fan on ticket listed on SG
